## How to configure settings to allow external resources to be loaded in
Curricula?

Alex is the LMS admin in an organisation and he has been assigned as the
application admin of Curricula. Curricula supports adding some kinds of
learning objects which may contain some external resources, and he wants all
content in a SCORM package is permitted in Curricula so that learners can view
the entire external content when starting their SCORM tasks. Now let’s see how
Alex will configure the content security policy to allow the external
resources.

1\. In Curricula, Alex clicks **Admin** on the left navigation pane, and then
clicks **Global settings**.

2\. In the **Content security policy** tab, he turns on the **Content security
policy** toggle. With the content security policy is enabled, Alex can
manually create policies for external resources that can be loaded in the
system.

***Note** : If Alex wants to allow all external resources, he can also disable
the policy.

3\. He clicks **Create** , enters the key and value for the policy.

Note the following:

• **Key** – Enter the fetch directive of the content of security.

• **Value** – Enter the URL of the restricted resource.

4\. When Alex finishes configuring the policy, he clicks **Save**.
